meanings.definition: The quality or state of being reduced in size, quantity, or complexity.
meanings.sent1: The reductiveness of the recipe made it easy for even beginners to follow.
meanings.sent2: I appreciated the reductiveness of the new phone model, as it was much simpler to use.
meanings.sent3: The reductiveness of the puzzle was so extreme that it only had four large pieces.
meanings.sent4: Her reductiveness in packing for the trip amazed everyone; she fit everything in a small backpack.
meanings.sent5: The reductiveness of the painting's details gave it a modern and minimalist feel.

meanings.definition: The act or process of simplifying or minimizing something.
meanings.sent1: The reductiveness of the explanation helped the students grasp the concept easily.
meanings.sent2: I believe in the reductiveness of clutter to create a more peaceful living space.
meanings.sent3: The reductiveness of his excuse for being late was that he lost track of time playing video games.
meanings.sent4: Her reductiveness in organizing her closet was so effective that she could find any item in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The reductiveness of the meeting agenda made the discussion focused and productive.
